Notes: "The results of these methods are generally consistent with the notion that reduced ambient humidity eventually yields a reduced reliance of languages on vowels, when compared to consonants. "
"The results suggest that voiced stops are in fact slightly less common in more arid regions, even after controlling for language family in this manner (p < 0.0001)"

"The results suggest that voiced stops are in fact slightly less common in more arid regions, even after controlling for language family in this manner (p < 0.0001). The same is true of rhotics (p < 0.001)."
"No significant phylogenetically controlled patterns were observed for laterals and nasals."
" No significant phylogenetically controlled patterns were observed for laterals and nasals. "
